comments:
After using a clean workspace once, but not creating any new connections and restarting, the local connection was gone.  Restarting as many times after didn't bring the connection back.

I was only able to produce this once, but Kushal also saw this problem.

Using today's synched up dev driver.

-----------Enter bugs above this line-----------
TM 2.0 Testing
installation : eclipse-SDK-3.3
RSE install  : RSE 2.0
java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_11-b03
os.name:     : Windows XP, Service Pack 2
------------------------------------------------

Do you still have that workspace? Could you check if Local has been persisted?

Look at .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.rse.core/profiles/**/H.local_*
Unfortunately I don't have the workspace still.  Next time I see this issue I will check if the connection was persisted.

I was able to reproduce this.  It seems to happen if you close Eclipse before it saves the profile for the first time.

This is an issue with closing Eclipse after doing any action that causes a profile to be saved.  If you create a filter then close Eclipse right away and load Eclipse again the new filter won't be displayed.

Error Log has this error:
An internal error occurred during: "Saving RSE Profile Kevin".

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PFMetadataAnchor.getProviderFolder(PFMetadataAnchor.java:74)
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PFMetadataAnchor.getProfileFolder(PFMetadataAnchor.java:85)
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PFMetadataAnchor.getProfileLocation(PFMetadataAnchor.java:39)
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PropertyFileProvider.saveRSEDOM(PropertyFileProvider.java:111)
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.PFMetatdataJob.run(PFMetatdataJob.java:62)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

> It seems to happen if you close Eclipse before it saves the profile for the
> first time.

Ok this would be very low priority then, I'd think.
